fig.label: Figure 1
fig.sd-panel: Primary BMDMs were stimulated with recombinant murine TNF (100 ng/ml) in combination with SM
Primary BMDMs were stimulated with recombinant murine TNF (100 ng/ml) in combination with TAK1i for 6 or 4 h respectively.

Time-lapse confocal images (hour:min) of BMDMs stimulated with recombinant murine TNF (100 ng/ml) and SM (250 nM) stained with propidium iodide (red) for 6 h. Black arrowheads indicate membrane ballooning while white arrowheads indicate apoptotic bodies.
immortalized BMDMs were stimulated with recombinant murine TNF (100 ng/ml) in combination with SM
immortalized BMDMs were stimulated with recombinant murine TNF (100 ng/ml) in combination with TAK1i for 6 or 4 h respectively.

fig.label: Figure 2
fig.sd-panel: BMDMs were stimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) in combination with TAK1i (125 nM) for the indicated time points. LDH release
BMDMs were stimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) in combination with TAK1i (125 nM) for the indicated time points. mixed supernatant and cell extracts were analysed.
Representation of known caspase cleavage site and molecular weight of corresponding cleavage fragment in mouse GSDMD.

BMDMs were costimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and TAK1i (125 nM) for 4 h in the presence or absence of KCl (50 mM). Where indicated, cells were pre-incubated with MCC950 (10 μM) 20-30 min prior to TNF/TAK1i stimulation.
BMDMs were costimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and SM (250 nM; 6 h) and mixed supernatant and cell extracts were analysed by immunoblot
BMDMs were costimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and SM LDH release in the cell culture supernatant were quantified at the indicated time points.
BMDMs were costimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and SM

fig.label: Figure 3
fig.sd-panel: HEK 293T cells were transfected with doxycycline-inducible DmrB-caspase-8 and the indicated GSDMD constructs. Cells were stimulated with doxycycline (10 μg/ml) for 18 h to induce DmrB-caspase-8 expression and exposed to B/B homodimerizer (12.5 nM) for another 2 h to activate caspase-8. Mixed supernatant and extracts were analysed by immunoblot.
Immortalized Gsdmd-/- BDMDs expressing GSDMDWT and GSDMDD88A were costimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and SM for 6 h and LDH release was quantified.
Immortalized Gsdmd-/- BDMDs expressing GSDMDWT and GSDMDD88A were primed for 3 h with ultrapure E. coli K12 LPS (100 ng/ml) and stimulated with LCL161 (1 μM) for 24 h and LDH release was quantified.
BMDMs were costimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and TAK1i for 4 h and (D) mixed supernatant and extracts were analysed by immunoblot
BMDMs were costimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and TAK1i for 4 h and LDH release was quantified at the indicated time points.

fig.label: Figure 4
fig.sd-panel: BMDMs were costimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and TAK1i (125 nM) for 4 h and LDH release was quantified Where indicated, cells were treated with the inhibitors Nec-1s (50 μM)
BMDMs were costimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and TAK1i (125 nM) for 4 h and LDH release was quantified

BMDMs were costimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and TAK1i (125 nM) for 4 h and mixed supernatant and extracts were analysed by immunoblot. Where indicated, cells were treated with the inhibitors MCC950 (10 μM), GSK'872 (1 μM), 20-30 min prior to cell stimulation. KCl (50 mM) was added together with TNF and TAK1i. To induce necroptosis, BMDMs were primed for 3 h with ultrapure E. coli K12 LPS (100 ng/ml) and Q-VD-OPh (10 μM) was added at the last 20-30 min of priming and stimulated with SM (500 nM) for 4 h.

BMDMs were costimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and TAK1i (125 nM) for 4 h and mixed supernatant and extracts were analysed by immunoblot. Where indicated, cells were treated with the inhibitors GSK'872 (1 μM), 20-30 min prior to cell stimulation.

BMDMs were costimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and TAK1i (125 nM) for 4 h and mixed supernatant and extracts were analysed by immunoblot. Where indicated, cells were treated with the inhibitors probenecid (1 mM) 20-30 min prior to cell stimulation. To activate the NLRP3 inflammasome, BMDM were primed with ultrapure E. coli K12 LPS (100 ng/ml) for 4 h and stimulated with nigericin (10 μM) for 1 h.

BMDMs were primed for 3 h with ultrapure E. coli K12 LPS (100 ng/ml) and stimulated with SM (0.5 μM) for a further 4 h. Probenecid (1 mM) was added 20-30 min prior to cell stimulation and mixed supernatant and extracts were analysed by immunoblot.
BMDMs were stimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and SM (0.5 μM) for 6 h and (G) mixed supernatant and extracts were analysed by immunoblot
BMDMs were stimulated with TNF (100 ng/ml) and SM (0.5 μM) for 6 h and LDH release was quantified.

fig.label: Figure 5
fig.sd-panel: BMDMs were stimulated with an increasing dose of S63845 in the presence of ABT-737 (0.5 μM) and LDH release was quantified at 6 h.
BMDMs were stimulated with an increasing dose of S63845 in the presence of ABT-737 (0.5 μM) and LDH release was quantified at 6 h.
BMDMs were stimulated with ABT-737 (0.5 μM) and S63845 (0.5 μM) and LDH release was quantified
BMDMs were stimulated with ABT-737 (0.5 μM) and S63845 (0.5 μM) mixed supernatant and extracts were analysed by immunoblot at 6 h
BMDMs were stimulated with ABT-737 (0.5 μM) and S63845 (0.5 μM) and LDH release was quantified
BMDMs were stimulated with ABT-737 (0.5 μM) and S63845 (0.5 μM) and mixed supernatant and extracts were analysed by immunoblot at 6 h

BMDMs were primed with ultrapure E. coli K12 LPS (100 ng/ml) for 3 h and further stimulated with ABT-737 (1 μM) and S63845 (1 μM) for 24 h and mixed supernatant and extracts were analysed by immunoblot
BMDMs were primed with ultrapure E. coli K12 LPS (100 ng/ml) for 3 h and further stimulated with ABT-737 (1 μM) and S63845 (1 μM) for 24 h and IL-1β in cell-free supernatant were quantified by ELISA
